Now, a film on MJ’s pet chimp

Michael Jackson’s pet chimpanzee Bubbles will be the centre of an animated film, produced by Community creator Dan Harmon and his Starburns Industries. The stop-motion film, titled Bubbles , is based on Isaac Adamson’s Black List-topping script and will tell the story of Jackson’s life from the perspective of his chimp, which became his frequent companion in the 1980s. Bubbles was adopted by Jackson from an Austin research facility and given residence at the Neverland Ranch in 1983.

The chimp was MJ’s frequent companion until it became overaggressive and was moved to a monkey sanctuary in Florida. — PTI
title: ENT-JACKSON
